intro: Leichhardtia suaveolens, commonly known as the sweet-scented leichhardtia, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Central and South America. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its attractive, showy flowers that range in color from white to pink, often with a subtle fragrance. It typically grows in moist, well-drained soils and thrives in full sun to partial shade. Leichhardtia suaveolens is valued in horticulture for its ornamental appeal and ability to attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
